item.title: Conventional vs. FHA Mortgages - Texas Homebuyer Comparison Guide
item.description:
Conventional vs. FHA Mortgages - Texas Homebuyer Comparison Guide

Texas homebuyers typically choose between conventional mortgages and FHA loans. Each loan type has different down payment requirements, credit score minimums, interest rates, and insurance costs. Understanding the differences helps you select the right loan program with your mortgage broker.

Conventional Mortgages: Lower Rates for Qualified Borrowers

Conventional mortgages are loans that conform to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac standards—not government-insured like FHA, VA, or USDA loans. Conventional mortgages typically offer lower interest rates when borrowers have strong credit, larger down payments, and steady income.

item.title: Jumbo Mortgages in Texas - Luxury Home Financing for Austin, Dallas, Houston
item.description:
Jumbo Mortgages in Texas - Luxury Home Financing for Austin, Dallas, Houston

Texas luxury real estate markets—Austin, Dallas, Houston, and San Antonio—increasingly require jumbo mortgages. Jumbo loans exceed the 2024 Fannie Mae conforming limit of $766,200, allowing homebuyers to finance luxury properties without government-backed pricing limitations. However, jumbo financing requires specialist lenders and broker expertise to secure competitive rates.

What Is a Jumbo Mortgage?

A jumbo mortgage is a loan exceeding Fannie Mae’s conforming loan limit ($766,200 in 2024; limits vary by county). Jumbo loans do not carry government insurance, requiring lenders to accept more risk and impose stricter qualification requirements.
